intro: Hieracium sbaense, commonly known as the Sbaen hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium sbaense is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to the mild, humid climate of its native region.
